intro: Gymnanthes pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's gymnanthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Gymnanthes pringlei produces a milky latex sap, which is a common trait among members of its family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
